Website Terms of Use

Modified April 17, 2019

Welcome to https://www.airship.com (the “Site”). This Site is intended to provide information about and access to Airship’s products and services. It allows you to interact with us and others and provides you the opportunity to contact us directly. While we want you to enjoy the experience of visiting our Site, we also want you to understand the terms to which you agree when visiting the Site. References to “we,” “our,” “us” or “Airship” herein refer to Airship Group, Inc., a Delaware corporation, d/b/a Airship, and our subsidiaries, service providers and designees as deemed appropriate by us.

You agree to use the Site only in accordance with the Terms, whether you are a “Visitor” (which means that you simply browse the Site) or you are a “Member” (which means you have registered with us for the Site). The term “User” means a “Visitor” or a “Member.” Please read and save all of the Terms. If you do not agree with the Terms, do not use this Site or any of its features. If you register to become a Member you may be required to indicate your acceptance to the Terms during the registration process.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, if you elect to purchase or otherwise obtain access to any of Airship’s products and services, you acknowledge and agree that your access to and use of all such products and services shall be subject to and governed solely by the terms of your agreement with Airship for such products and services and these Terms do not apply.

We may amend or terminate any Terms at any time and such amendment or termination will be effective at the time we post the revised Terms on the Site. Each time you use the Site you should visit and review the then current Terms that apply to your transactions and use of this Site. Your continued use of the Site after we have posted revised Terms signifies your acceptance of such revised Terms. If you are dissatisfied with the Site, its content or any Terms (including as modified), you agree that your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue using the Site. The Terms are the entire agreement between you and Airship with respect to your use of the Site.

(c) you will maintain the accuracy of such information. and (d) your use of the Site and its features does not violate any applicable law or regulation.

The Terms, as we may revise them from time to time, shall remain in full force and effect while you use the Site features or are a Member. You may terminate your Membership at any time, for any reason, by providing written notice to us. We may terminate your Membership at any time, for any or no reason, with or without prior notice or explanation, and without liability. Even after Membership is terminated, the Terms will remain in effect and you will remain bound by them except that your right to use the Site as a Member will terminate.

Tampering with the Site, misrepresenting the identity or age of a user, using buying agents or conducting fraudulent activities on the Site are prohibited.

Your Privacy

When you visit our website, we may store or retrieve information on your browser, mostly in the form of cookies. This information might be about you, your preferences or your device and is mostly used to make the site work as you expect it to. Because we respect your right to privacy, you can choose not to allow some types of cookies. Click on the different category headings to find out more and change our default settings. However, blocking some types of cookies may impact your experience of the site and the services we are able to offer.

Privacy Statement

Effective as of September 19, 2022. — Previous Version

Airship Group, Inc. and its affiliates, including, Apptimize, LLC., Urban Airship UK Ltd., Urban Airship Germany GmbH, Airship France SAS, and Urban Airship India Private Ltd. (collectively, “Airship,” “we” or “us”) offers mobile and customer engagement platforms, including the Gummicube ASO services. . Airship is committed to protecting the privacy of Personal Information you provide to us, and applies the Privacy by Design and Data Protection by Default principles across our product enhancement, development, and operations. . When referring to “Personal Information” in this Statement, we mean information that relates to an identified or identifiable individual, and can include information about how you engage with our Services (e.g. your name, email address, device information, IP Address). Accordingly, Airship provides this privacy and information practices statement to inform you about our information practices, the kinds of information we may collect, how we intend to use and share that information, and how you can correct or change such information (“Privacy Statement”).

1. What this Privacy Statement covers.

This Privacy Statement applies to Personal Information that we collect when you: (i) visit websites we operate and that link to this Privacy Statement, including www.airship.com and www.apptimize.com (the “Sites”). (ii) use our training and testing mobile or software applications, mobile wallet passes, or any other software applications made available by us for use on or through computers and mobile devices that link to this Privacy Statement. (iii) visit our branded social media pages. (iv) visit our offices. (v) receive communications from us, including emails, phone calls or texts. (vi) register for, attend and/or otherwise take part in our events, webinars or contests. (vii) submit a job application to us. (viii) submit information to us in connection with a potential business relationship with us. or (ix) register to use the Airship Platform as an authorized user (for example, as an employee of one of our customers who provided you with login access to the Airship Platform) or contact us for support, referred to in this Statement as “Account Information”, (collectively, including the Sites, the “Services”). . “You” refers to any individual who visits or uses the Services.

In general, with respect to the Personal Information we collect directly from the Sites or other Services, Airship is a data controller. This means that as a data controller we determine the purposes for which and the manner in which the Personal Information we collect is to be processed. 

With the exception of Account Information, this Privacy Statement does not apply to our security and privacy practices concerning the Personal Information we receive and process on behalf of our customers through Airship’s technology platforms (including the Airship Customer Engagement Platform, and the Apptimize Testing Platform) and related services (collectively, “Airship Platform”). . In this capacity, we are acting in the role of a data processor or service provider on behalf of our customers, and our security and privacy commitments are detailed in and governed by our agreements with our customers, including the Terms of Subscription Service or such other applicable agreement entered into between our customer and Airship and that is related to our customer’s access to and use of the Airship Platform. Airship does not have control over and is not responsible for the data practices of our customers. . For privacy information related to our customers’ uses of the Airship Platform in connection with their mobile applications, websites, emails, texts or other digital properties, please reach out to the respective customer directly. 

In addition, the Services may contain links to other third party websites. . The privacy statements and policies of such third party websites govern their respective personal information and security practices as provided in Section 12 of this Privacy Statement. California residents and customers with business in the State of California may read our supplemental CCPA Privacy Notice here.

2. What Personal Information does Airship collect?

The Personal Information we collect will be determined by the type of interaction you have with Airship, as described in further detail in the following categories:  

2.1 Personal Information we collect directly.

Site usage. When you use the Services or fill out forms on our Site, we may provide you with opportunities to sign up to receive specific information or Services, download content, or register for an event or webinar, and we may ask for your contact information. Personal Information we may collect includes, but is not limited to: . name, title, company name, industry, company address, phone number or email address, country, downloads and engagement with Airship content and other publications. . Our sites use cookies and other technologies, and as a result we also collect information as described in Section 5 below. When activating or installing updates to our mobile applications or mobile wallet passes, we may collect information about your device (manufacturer, model, IP address), or information about the application such as the version, date of activation, successful or unsuccessful updates. 

Registering for and attending a meeting or an event. . If you register to attend an event or meeting (whether in . person or online), we may ask for your contact information (name and email address), job title, employer, and may retain copies of meeting audio and video recording in accordance with our Data Retention Policy and based on your consent to participate in a recorded meeting. If you attend an event, we may, with your consent, scan your attendee badge which will provide us with your information, such as name, title, company name, address, country, phone number,email address, and record of event attendance.

Your communications with us. We collect Personal Information from you such as name, email address, phone number, mailing address, job title, marketing subscription status, and information regarding your engagement with Airship content and other publications when you request information about our Services, register for our newsletter, download or otherwise engage with our content and publications, request customer or technical support, apply for a job or engage with a job posting, or otherwise communicate with us.

Account Information for Airship Platform. If you register to use the Airship Platform as an authorized user . or sign up for a free account, we collect Personal Information about you that may include name, email address, IP address, company name, job title, and website name or information.  

Surveys. We may contact you to participate in surveys. If you decide to participate, you may be asked to provide certain information which may include name, email address, employer, job title and other contact information.. 

Social media content. We may offer forums, blogs, or social media pages. Any content you provide on these channels will be considered “public” and is not subject to privacy protections.

Registration for sweepstakes or contests. We may run sweepstakes and contests. . Contact information you provide may be used to reach you about the sweepstakes or contest and for other promotional, marketing and business purposes, if permitted by law. 3. How does Airship use Personal Information and what are the legal bases for these uses?

We use Personal Information that we collect about you or that you provide to us for a range of different business purposes. . Depending on how you interact with us, we and our third-party service providers use Personal Information in a variety of ways, including:

Providing information and Services you requested. We may use the Personal Information about you to fulfill requests for programs, Services, or information that you may request such as information about potential or future Services, including to: (a) generally manage your information and accounts. (b) respond to questions, comments and requests. (c) provide access to certain areas and features of the Services. (d) link or combine information we get from others to help understand your needs and provide you with better Service. and (e) allow you to register for events, participate in a contest or promotion, post in a forum or participate in webinars, and provide related information and communications.

To fulfill a contract or take steps linked to a contract. This is relevant when you register for the Airship Platform. We may use the Personal Information about you for administrative purposes or to fulfill the obligations of a contract, including, without limitation, to: (a) to fulfill your and prospective customers’ requests related to the Airship Platform or other products that you have requested. (b) to provide you with the Airship Platform for which you have registered. (c) perform internal quality control. (d) maintain and improve our Services. (e) verify identity. (f) send communications regarding the Services, your account, or any changes to any Airship policy or terms of use. (g) process payments. (h) provide technical and customer support. and (i) enforce our Terms of Use, Acceptable Use Policy or other agreement entered into with you.

Marketing products and services. We may use Personal Information about you to provide you with materials about offers, products and services offered by us, including new content or information about future services. We may provide you with these materials by phone, postal mail, text or email, as permitted by applicable law. Such uses include: (a) to tailor content, advertisements, and offers. (b) to notify you about offers, products, and services that may be of interest to you. (c) to provide Services to you. (d) measure interest in the Services. (e) process and deliver contest entries and rewards. (f) monitor and analyze trends, usage and activities in connection with our Services. (g) for other purposes disclosed at the time that you provide Personal Information. or (h) otherwise with your consent. If you do not wish us to use your Personal Information for marketing purposes, you may contact us at any time to opt out of the use of your Personal Information for such purposes, as further described below.

Research and development. We may use your Personal Information to create non-identifiable information that we may use alone or in the aggregate with information obtained from other sources, in order to help us to optimally deliver our existing products and Services or develop new products, processes and services. 

Deidentified and aggregated data. We may use your Personal Information and other information about you to create de-identified or aggregated information, such as de-identified demographic information, de-identified location information, information about the computer or device from which you access the Sites or other online Services, or other analyses we create. De-identified or aggregated information is used for a variety of functions, including the measurement of visitors’ interest in and use of various portions or features of the Services. De-identified or aggregated information is not Personal Information, does not identify you or any individual, and Airship may use such information in a number of ways, including research, internal analysis, analytics and any other legally permissible purposes. We may share this information within Airship and with third parties for our or their purposes in a de-identified or aggregated form that is designed to prevent anyone from identifying you. 

Public content. If you post any content to our website forums or social media accounts, we may publish this content and make it generally available to any user or visitor of our website.

Complying with legal obligations.  We may use your Personal Information when cooperating with public and government authorities, courts or regulators in accordance with our legal obligation under applicable laws to protect our rights or as necessary to protect against misuse or abuse of our Sites or Services, prevent potentially prohibited or illegal activities and fraud, promote safety and security of the Services and in protecting our rights and the rights of others, pursuing remedies available to us and limiting our damages, complying with judicial proceedings, court orders or legal processes or to respond to lawful requests.

Other Uses. We may use your Personal Information for other purposes disclosed to you at the time you provide Personal Information, with your consent or to conduct our business and pursue our legitimate interests, such as registering and managing visitors to our offices, investigating and responding to any comments or complaints that you may send us, providing internal training, and recruiting, interviewing and hiring job candidates.

Business Transfers. 5. What device and usage data does Airship process?

We use common information-gathering tools for collecting usage data, cookies, web beacons and similar technologies to automatically collect information that may contain Personal Information from your computer or mobile device as you navigate our Sites or use our Services.

5.1 Cookies, web beacons and other tracking technologies in our Services.   

As you navigate the Sites and use the Services, certain passive information may also be collected through the use of cookies, web beacons and other tracking technologies to obtain certain information about your computer, device, browsing actions, and patterns. This includes IP addresses, cookie IDs, navigational data, content clicked, the name of the domain and host from which you access the Internet, the browser software you use and your operating system, your browser settings, your device type and similar information, the date and time you access our Services and other device identifiers. This type of information is used for the purposes of gathering data to provide improved administration of our Services and to improve the quality of your experience when interacting with our Services (see Your Privacy Rights section below for more information). If you consent to the use of cookies and web beacons when you navigate the Sites and use the Services, we will collect information through those tools. 

Cookies. A cookie is a small text file that a website saves on your computer or mobile device when you visit the website. Cookies are then sent back to the originating website on each subsequent visit, or to another website that recognizes that cookie, to develop a record of the user’s online activity. When you visit our Sites, we or an authorized third party may place a cookie on your browser and/or device which collects information, including Personal Information, about your online activities over time and across different sites. . Cookies allow us to track usage, determine your browsing preferences and improve and customize your browsing experience. . For more information about cookies and web beacons, please visit http://www.allaboutcookies.org/.  

We use both session-based and persistent cookies on our Sites. . Session-based cookies exist only during one session and disappear from your computer when you close your browser or turn off your computer or device. . Persistent cookies remain on your computer or device after you close or turn off. You can control the use of cookies at the individual browser level, but choosing to disable cookies may limit your use of certain features or functions on our Services.  

Types of cookies on our Sites.

  • Essential Cookies. These cookies are necessary for the Sites to function and cannot be switched off. Some examples include: session cookies needed to transmit the website, authentication cookies, and security cookies. These cookies also support certain features on the Sites, such as the live chat feature. You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will then not work. 
  • Functional Cookies. . These cookies enhance functions, performance and services on the Sites. They enable us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our Sites. Functional cookies also enable us to improve how our Sites function and to help us provide you with more relevant communications, including marketing communications. . They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around and use the Sites. We may use our own technology or third-party technology to track and analyze usage information to provide enhanced interactions and more relevant communications and to enable certain features on the Sites.
  • Targeting Cookies. . These cookies track activity across websites in order to understand a visitor’s interest, and to direct specific marketing to them. . Targeting and advertising cookies may be set through our Site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites. 

To change your cookie settings and preferences for the Site you are visiting, use the Cookie Settings link at the bottom of the webpage. 

Web beacons. We also use web beacons (sometimes called “pixel tags” or “tracking pixels”). These are tiny graphics files that contain a unique identifier that is embedded in our Sites and in our emails or other communications that are sent through our Services. This enables us, for example, to monitor the traffic patterns of users from one page within our Site to another, to track access to the communications sent through our services, to understand whether you have come to our Sites from an online advertisement displayed on a third-party website or whether you have viewed advertisements on our Sites or through the Services, or to improve our Sites’ performance. For more information about cookies, and how to disable them, please see “Your Privacy Choices” below.

SDKs. We may use third party APIs and software development kits (“SDKs”) as part of the functionality of our Services. APIs and SDKs may allow third parties, including analytics and advertising partners, to collect your personal information for various purposes including to provide analytics services and content that is more relevant to you.

Airship may collect Personal Information to enable individuals to use online social media resources offered either by Airship or a third party. We may also enable you to use these social media resources to post or share Personal Information with others. When using social media resources, you should take into careful consideration what Personal Information you share with others.

You can also opt out of our analytics partners by setting your preference in the Cookie Settings link at the bottom of the web page of the Site you are visiting.
